runs.comm: starts with a wide down the leg side, fairly full, 136kph, a bit of swing, just starts on the wrong line
back of a length, a bit of inswing, goes on the back foot to tuck it through square leg
full, a bit of swing into middle stump. Williamson gets his front foot out of the way and clips neatly through midwicket
length ball on middle stump, blocked towards midwicket
fairly full on middle stump. Williamson stays on the back foot, plays late to defend towards backward point
back of a length, a bit of inward movement to cramp Williamson, who looks to stay leg-side of the ball and dab behind point. Can only chop it down behind the wicket, towards the keeper
back of a length, the line is just a touch too leg-stumpish, and Williamson misses the leg glance but it runs off the thigh pad to the fine leg boundary
flat, fired into the pads, works it away, can't get it past the square leg fielder
a bit fuller, again keeps it on that leg-stump line, and he comes forward to push to mid-on
down the track first ball, but he can't get to the pitch of this arm ball on off stump, can only chop it down towards short third man
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to square leg

back of a length, no turn, and he punches straight to the man at cover. Williamson calls for the single, Guptill responds a little late, and then he's sent back. Too late, and the throw at the bowler's end leaves plenty of time to complete the run-out with both batsmen near the middle of the pitch. Williamson even made a late, desperate attempt to run past Guptill and sacrifice his wicket, but he couldn't manage it
flat, angling into the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
fullish close to off stump, doesn't quite come on for the off-drive, and he plays it into the leg side off the inner half of his bat
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to whip it away through square leg
down the track comes Munro and the length isn't full enough for the drive over cover. Hits high on the bat and runs down to third man
sees him making room and bowls a shortish ball on leg stump. Still manages to punch it firmly but can't beat cover point
shortish on off stump, doesn't time his pull, drags it slowly to the left of deep square leg
not quite short enough for the pull, plays it down quietly to midwicket
slower ball angling across Williamson, who leaves his crease and is beaten playing a half-hearted poke, looking to run it down to third man
length ball on leg stump, tucked away to the left of short fine leg, and Gul stops it with a desperate, slow-motion slide
shot! That's a flat, golf drive. Full on off stump and he just stood there, cleared his front leg a touch, and flat-batted that back over the bowler's head
pulls his length ball just a touch, and sends in a quick one that jags in a touch - 145kph. Munro looks to slog into the leg side and it ricochets off his pad into the off side

slower ball. Williamson backs away, looking to make room, and Amir slides it wider, forcing him to reach for it. Goes through with the shot, toe-ends it high in the air. Drops down to Afridi at cover, and he drops a sitter.
quick bouncer outside off, rises steeply, over the bat as Munro leans back looking to ramp over the keeper

down the track and Imad fires it in full, into the batsman to deny width, and the attempted cover drive goes off the inside half of the bat through midwicket. A bit of drift in as well, and it kept going with the arm
flat, quick, back of a length, angling into leg stump, punched to long-on
quickish length ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
down the track, gets too close to the full ball outside off, whips to long-on
back of a length on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched straight to extra cover, stationed right on the edge of the circle
back of a length on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
slower ball, angling away from off stump from a fullish length. Munro clears his front leg, slogs, and misses
another slower ball but this one is short, and it sits up at waist height for Munro to clear his front leg and club away high over the midwicket boundary
down the track and Gul looks to slant it wide of Munro, but he gets down low and reaches it with his hands, flat-bats powerfully over the extra cover fielder
full on off stump and it's right in the slot for Munro's big, free swing to launch that down the ground and into the sightscreen

follows up with the short ball and Munro plays it cleverly, late, just letting it rise over his back shoulder and leaning away to ramp it to the short boundary at third man, almost right behind the keeper
flat and quick, angles it down the leg side. Was looking to follow the batsman's movement and ended up overdoing it
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to whip towards deep midwicket
flat, angling down leg, tucked away towards long leg
back of a length on off stump, worked aeway through square leg
tossed up, pushed through the point region
A full ball on the pads, Munro continues to take the pressure off, slog-sweeping flat and far over deep square leg
length ball sliding on towards leg stump, misses the sweep and it runs off the pad into the off side. Big appeal, but it pitched outside leg
quick length ball angling down leg. Looks to walk across and whip over short fine leg, can't connect. Rolls off the pad to short fine leg
back of a length outside off, mistimes the back foot punch and jabs to mid-off
full, looks to make room to jab through the off side, ends up inside-edging into the leg side
quick short ball, gets big on Munro, who's late on the hook, and he top-edges it all the way over the fine leg boundary
length ball on middle stump, opens up and clubs it away through backward square leg
slower ball on off stump, clears his front leg, adjusts to let it come on, and whips it away towards deep backward square leg
full on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
flighted ball, comes down the track and clips to long-on
tossed up on off stump and he gets down on one knee for the slog-sweep, hits it to the right of the fielder at deep midwicket
length ball on leg stump, reverse-sweeps firmly to the deep point fielder
full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
full, follows Munro's movement away from leg stump, and he misses the flick and the ball hits him low on the pads

bam. Follows up with a short ball, sits up at a nice height outside off and Munro swivels to pull it away over the square leg boundary. Follows up his 14-ball half-century against Sri Lanka with a 25-ball fifty here, against a better bowling attack. Well played!
full-toss outside off, plays a checked push to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and whips it away through backward square leg
bowled him! That was very full outside off, almost a yorker, and he jabbed at it with an angled bat looking to squeeze it through point, and all he could do was inside-edge it into his stumps
full-toss on middle and leg, whipped away through square leg
beaten first ball. Not short enough for the cut and it hurries past his outside edge
and he's gone! length ball, stops on the batsman, and he checks the drive and pops it straight back to Imad
down the track first ball and Imad fires it into his feet. Can only jab the attempted flick back towards the bowler
flighted on leg stump, driven inside-out to long-off
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to dab towards backward point
length ball on middle and leg, cramping the batsman for room, blocked towards point
shortish googly, turning into the pads, tucked away through square leg
back of a length sliding onto off stump, makes room to dab but can't beat short third man
full and quick wide of off and it beats Williamson as he reaches out to jab
down the track to the wide flighted ball and flat-bats it to the extra cover boundary. First really fluent shot from him in a long time
full, cramps him for room, pokes it into the mid-on region and the bowler moves across to field
full and flat on off stump, can't get under it as he makes room for the inside-out drive, ends up chipping it on the bounce to long-off
full, angling in, worked away through midwicket
not short enough to cut, chopped away to point
comes down the track and can't reach the pitch of a slower, tossed-up ball, poked back to the bowler
sees him coming down the track and shortens his length a touch. Pushed at the drive and edged it past the keeper, runs away quickly to the third man boundary
shortish outside off, drags the pull around to wide long-on
gone! Down the track, looking to make room, and Afridi bowled a wide googly. Reached out for the flat-bat drive and ended up dragging it into his stumps off the inside edge
flat, back of a length, slides in to cramp Ronchi as he backs away to cut. Can only jab it down into the pitch
full, angling down leg, misses the flick and it hits him on the pad
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
a bit slower this time and he's picked up another! Ronchi comes forward to drive, it grips and turns away from him, and he has to reach out for it, ends up popping a simple catch to the man at cover
googly, beats the outside edge and hits the pad as Santner looks to work it through the leg side. Long, agonising appeal, but that pitched a long way outside leg stump
very full outside off, Williamson skips across to clip to long-on

full on middle, looking for the yorker, clips to square leg looking for the single, has to return in a hurry. Maqsood throws on the bounce, misses the stumps. A better throw could have had Santner in trouble
yorker close to off stump, dug out to backward point. This is a superb over so far.

full, a bit of width outside off, and Afridi pulls off an absolute stunner! Santner looks to lift it inside-out, doesn't get the desired elevation, and Afridi takes a couple of steps back from cover, leaped up and backwards, and took a sensational overhead catch while turning around and landing on his elbow
low full-toss wide of off stump, sliced away to deep point
once again, full, almost in the blockhole, no width, jabbed straight back to the bowler
full outside off, driven away to the right of deep point
yorker on off and middle, jabbed back to the bowler

full on middle stump, not quite yorker length, and Williamson puts it away cool as a cucumber. Walks across his stumps, and picks it up with his bat pointing skywards, lifts it up and over the fine leg boundary

wide yorker, and Williamson loves that bit of width, just jams down with an angled bat and steers it into the gap to the left of backward point. No way third man was getting to that. What a way to bring up his half-century
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
super bouncer, quick and rising steeply over middle stump. All Astle can do is sway away and evade it
full and wide, can't beat extra cover with his drive
full-toss outside off, and Amir is denied another wicket! That's sliced away straight to backward point, and Maqsood puts down a simple, waist-high chance

walks across to try and scoop and Amir widens his length. Ends up poking it into to midwicket region, and takes off for a single. Amir runs across quickly, and misses with a throw to the bowler's end. Would have been out by miles had he hit
full on middle stump and Williamson clips it away so easily. Pick-up shot, up and over and into the straight midwicket boundary
shot! Looks for the yorker and gives him too much width with a low full-toss, and Williamson steers it with an open face into the big gap to the left of the backward point fielder
back of a length on off stump, jabbed into the point region
sees him coming down the track and bowls a full ball wide of off stump. Reaches out and can't put bat to ball
shot! This time he stays in his crease and Gul's attempted yorker ends up as a wide half-volley. Gets under it, slices it beautifully over point
yorker, angling down leg, clipped to fine leg
yorker, and leg stump is dislodged. That was pinpoint, sneaks under Astle's bat as he jams down desperately to try and clip into the leg side
nearly sneaks another through. Superb yorker again, but Henry manages to jam his bat down on it and get an inside-edge to squeeze it away to the boundary, to the right of the fine leg fielder
bouncer outside off, skids through at shoulder height and Henry can't connect with the attempted pull
walks across his stumps and Amir follows with the full ball. Clipped away through midwicket
back of a length outside off, beats Williamson's attempt to stab that through point
in the blockhole outside off, stabbed away towards cover, where Afridi stops it falling to his left

length ball on leg stump and that's a poor ball under the circumstances. Henry clears his front leg and clubs it away to the right of the deep midwicket fielder. Poor attempt from Shoaib Malik on the boundary, too slow to move across
full outside off, swiped away towards long-on
wide yorker, that was slanted beyond the tramline outside off, and Henry reaches out and misses. Called wide, rightly so
low full-toss outside off and Afridi takes a simple catch! Flat-batted straight to cover
gone! Williamson's long fight ends. Full on leg stump, looks to flick it over the backward square leg region, is a little too early into the shot, and he picks out the fielder at deep square leg
in the blockhole outside off, jabbed to cover

wide yorker, perfect line to slide it under the bat as he looks to jab it away through point. Boult takes off, looking to steal a bye. Sarfraz throws it to the bowler, who decides to race with Boult to the crease instead of flinging the ball at the stumps, and Boult makes it to his crease
full outside off, driven to long-off
very full outside off, plays and misses looking to jab it through point

sees him backing away to make room, follows with the length ball at the body. Looks to hit inside-out, the ball hits high on his bat and he scoops a simple catch to cover, where Afridi settles under the ball
